definition: to belittle/to look down upon/to despise
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]

sentences.english: The threat from ice formations of 100km long should not be underestimated.
sentences.chinese: 长达100公里的冰川阵不能小视。

sentences.english: The problem of rising sea level is a potential threat for agriculture which is not to be neglected.
sentences.chinese: 海平面上升的潜在威胁，万万不可小视。

sentences.english: Children's literature produced in Shaanxi province is non-negligible on the landscape of contemporary children's literature.
sentences.chinese: 陕西儿童文学在当代儿童文学版图里，是不可小视的。

sentences.english: Thus, the two factories factors can not be belittled .
sentences.chinese: 因此，这两个利空因素的影响不可小视。

sentences.english: J. has had an impact on the team this season.
sentences.chinese: 本赛季对球队的影响也不容小视。

sentences.english: And “ordinary” flu is not to be taken lightly.
I'll show you a little video.
sentences.chinese: 我要给你搌市一个小视频。

sentences.english: This is not, in my view, a minor matter.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来，这件问题不容小视。

sentences.english: This quest for dignity has produced aremarkable democratic wave.
sentences.chinese: “尊严之诉”产生了一股不可小视的民主浪潮。

definition: treat sth lightly/to lower one's guard
lit. to speak of two things on the same day (idiom); to mention things on equal terms (often with negatives: you can't mention X at the same time as Y)
to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
(in the negative) (not) to be trifled with
